text: Dresden is a city in Decatur County, Kansas, United States. As of the 2020 census, 43 people lived there. == History == Dresden was created in 1888. It was named by German settlers after the city of Dresden, in Germany. The first post office in Dresden was created in October 1888. Dresden was a station on the Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railroad. == Geography == Dresden is at (39.622762, -100.41905). According to the United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. == People == === 2020 census === The 2020 census says that there were 43 people, 20 households, and 7 families living in the city. The median age was 53.5 years. Of the people, 93.0% were White and 7.0% were two or more races. None were Hispanic or Latino. === 2010 census === The 2010 census says that there were 41 people, 19 households, and 12 families living in the city. == References == == Other websites == ;City * Dresden - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 294, local school district ;Maps * Dresden City Map , KDOT Category:1888 establishments in Kansas Category:Cities in Kansas
title: Dresden, Kansas
